title: LRD v6: Empirical Evidence for Long-Range Dependence / Fractal Memory (Multi-domain real-world datasets)
description:
Companion to: LRD v5 – Monte Carlo Validation (DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.17800770)

This release extends the synthetic Monte-Carlo validation (LRD v5) with a cross-domain empirical evidence layer. Using a conservative DFA-2 + block-bootstrap + phase-randomized surrogate test pipeline, we demonstrate that fractal memory signatures arise in real systems across multiple domains:

  • Finance/Crypto: Bitcoin volatility clustering (|log-returns| show H > 0.5 while raw returns show H ≈ 0.5)
  • Geophysics: Earthquake activity clustering (USGS catalog)
  • Physiology: Heart rate variability RR intervals (PhysioNet)
  • Genomics: DNA sequence correlations (NCBI GenBank)

The program is falsifiable and audit-driven: we separate returns from volatility, report uncertainty via block bootstrap CI, test against phase-randomized surrogates, and document dataset provenance and licensing constraints.

AI Relevance: This work provides a reproducible benchmark for AI forecasting and agentic decision systems operating under persistent risk dynamics in financial markets.

Raw third-party datasets are not redistributed; the package ships code, documentation, and example outputs.
notes: Third-party data sources and their licenses are documented in docs/DATA_SOURCES.md and docs/THIRD_PARTY_NOTICES.md. This package ships only code and derived outputs by default. See the companion package LRD v5 (DOI: 10.5281/zenodo.17800770) for synthetic Monte-Carlo validation.
